results.title: The Cat in the hat
results.brief_description: Impulsive and imaginative, the Cat romps through the house dispelling boredom for a brother and sister on a rainy day, while their mother is away. Invites children to become self-sufficient in their use of time. Adapted from the book by Dr. Seuss.

results.title: The Cat family
results.brief_description: Shows how a number of animals may differ in size, colour and habitat, yet possess common characteristics. Studies the domestic cat and includes scenes of the larger cats, including the tiger, lynx and leopard. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Cashmere story
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe and Robert Pringle and Son
results.brief_description: Hawick, in Scotland, has been the centre of a thriving knitting trade for over 200 years. Shows the raw material of the industry, obtained from the Kashmir goat in the mountains beyond the Himalayas, transformed into the finished product. Highly skilled workers are seen making the articles for which the industry is justly famous. Historic Edinburgh provides the setting for a display of fashionable sweater designs.

results.title: The Case of the travelling garden
results.creator_credit: Raymond Leach, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Department of Customs checks on all plants being brought into Australia and administers agricultural quarantine regulations. Travellers are required to leave behind all fruit and vegetables, flowers and bulbs for these may be disease-carrying. Australia is fortunate in having so much agriculture which is free from any overseas pests and diseases. Uses animation. (For the Plant Quarantine Publicity Campaign, 1972).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Raymond Leach, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: The Case of the cosmic comic
results.creator_credit: Gary Templeton, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Homer Price’s good friend Freddy is a true-blue hero worshipper whose idol is the azure-caped Super-Duper. After meeting the super-human hero in person at the Centerburg movie theatre, the boys encounter him again - only this time the Super-Duper is badly in need of their assistance. From the book “Homer Price” by Robert McCloskey.

results.title: The Car man: Pininfarina
results.creator_credit: Denis Postle, Anthony de Lotbinière and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Pacemakers”.
Pininfarina, the world’s greatest name in automobile design, founder of a firm which builds 25,000 car bodies a year, and designs many others. Farina has used his uncanny feeling for the look and shape of cars to build a unique industry - an industry which is ideally suited to a comparatively small industrial nation like Italy, and which has given her a reputation unequalled in the world. Commentary written and spoken by Anthony Jay.

results.title: The car body: materials and design
results.brief_description: Summary: three alternative materials to steel for car bodies are highlighted. fully functional cars which have been made in glass reinforced plastic, wood and plastic are shown and their designers justify the use of these materials. there is a discussion
